title: Christian Pulisic won't let lack of game time at Chelsea impact performances for USA
text:
Christian Pulisic said he won't let his benching with Chelsea affect his performances for the United States.

Pulisic and his nation are preparing for a match against Cuba after a spell in which he has been out of Frank Lampard's side, but he has pronounced himself in peak form despite scant playing time of late.

'I feel the best I ever have. I feel very confident in my game. I'm not going to let any of that affect me,' Pulisic said Wednesday.

Christian Pulisic said he won't let his benching with Chelsea affect his play for the US

'I feel very strong, and I'm really looking forward to this game (on) Friday.'

The 21-year-old midfielder has been mostly a spectator in his first season in the Premier League, playing in just one league match since August - a 10-minute stint on Sunday during which he contributed an assist.

Pulisic arrived at Chelsea in the summer for £58million from Borussia Dortmund.

He has previously voiced frustration with his playing time under Chelsea manager Lampard but declined to elaborate on those feelings.

The American winger has only made one appearance in the Premier League since August

'I'm here now to be focused with the US national team, so that's really all that's on my mind right now,' Pulisic said.

The United States face Cuba on Friday in Washington and then visit Canada in Toronto on Tuesday, in their opening two matches of the CONCACAF Nations League.

While he's been a bit part player with Chelsea, Pulisic is the undisputed star of the US side, which is trying to recover from its failure to qualify for last year's World Cup in Russia.
